headline: Blueberry Sour Cream Coffee Cake
description: This moist sour cream blueberry coffee cake is packed with flavor thanks to juicy blueberries, cinnamon, and pecan nuts. A wonderful weekend treat!

video.description: Just five basic ingredients, and dinner’s ready in less than an hour.
video.name: Blueberry Sour Cream Coffee Cake

name: Blueberry Sour Cream Coffee Cake

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour a 9-inch Bundt pan.
Beat sugar and butter together in a large bowl with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in sour cream and vanilla extract.
Combine flour, baking powder, and salt; stir into butter mixture until just blended. Fold in blueberries; spoon 1/2 of the batter into the prepared pan.

Combine brown sugar, pecans, and cinnamon in a small bowl; sprinkle 1/2 of the mixture over batter in the pan. Spoon remaining batter on top, then sprinkle over remaining pecan mixture. Use a knife or thin spatula to swirl the sugar layer into the cake.

Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 1 hour. Cool briefly on a wire rack. Invert carefully onto a serving plate; dust with confectioners' sugar just before serving.

review.reviewBody: Yum! Delicious recipe! Seeing that other reviewers had trouble with undone-ness, I thawed my frozen blueberries, strained out the excess liquid and coated them with flour before folding them in. I wonder if the nutty crumble should've gone into the bundt pan first so that there would be a crumbly top. Will try that next time. I ended up drizzling it with a thin buttercream frosting with orange extract. It came out beautifully for an extended family brunch and I was asked to share the recipe!
Fell Fall Fallen Made twice never again! I do not understand, what is the secret of all those who hv success.
Very good!!

I baked it for 1 hour and 5 minutes. When I checked it earlier, the tooth pick came out clean, but the cake did not feel done. I don't usually touch it to test, but it was clearly not done. When I checked it again, it was better, so I took it out. The toothpick still came out clean. I let it cool a bit, and it fell. Then I cut in it to check. It was not done. It was like batter in the middle. I tried to salvage it by putting it back in the oven. I ended up doing this twice for 15 extra minutes 2 times. It was better but still not fully baked. I've never had a toothpick come out clean when it was not done. I guess it's because it's mostly fat - butter and sour cream. Bakers beware. It still tasted pretty good. I joked that it was blueberry lava cake.
I used plain yogurt instead of sour cream. I'm thinking it changed the texture a bit, but I haven't tried it with sour cream yet. It was yummy!
I love Blueberry muffins, OMG!!!

I have no idea how this recipe has been rated so high! I'm an experienced baker and after 4 attempts, 6 pounds of butter later I've got nothing but soggy, dense, useless flops! The recipe has way too much fat for the amount of flour. It baked up nice for the first 50 minutes, and then it flopped into a pile of mush! If you want a good Blueberry Coffee Cake, use "To Die for Blueberry Muffins" recipe and put it in your desired pan instead of muffin tins. That is a 5 star recipe!
Oh my goodness, this was absolutely perfect! Made the recipe exactly like the recipe and it was a hit! Making another one today due to popular demand!

This was tremendous! I did alter it a bit after reading some reviews, 1 and 3/4 cup sugar and one and three quarter cup flour and two cups of blueberries instead of one. I sprayed a 9x13 pan and then floured it and I think that made a difference in not sticking. I poured half of the batter in added the two cups of blueberries and half of the strudel, put the rest of the batter on top, know that it will be hard to spread out but it doesn't have to be perfect. Be perfect. I tapped with the rest of the strudel and baked for 45 minutes. I will probably be making another loaf this week!
Delicious! Used less sugar and it turned out lovely!

The 1st time I made this it was gone in an hour, so I made a second one, and there was one piece left for breakfast. I used glazed pecans as that was what I had on hand. This is my most favorite coffee cake. I always use the glazed pecans, because I don't want to change the taste. Sorry, no photo, it's in the oven.

I made it exactly as the recipe stated. Unable to remove from bundt pan in one nice piece. I should have floured the blueberries as I normally do when making muffins. They sank and stuck to the pan. When I make again, I will also increase flour to 2 cups to give it more body.
I liked this recipe. Especially this a bit sour taste from sour cream and also it had a creamy texture. Although I replaced blueberry with strawberry
I made this exactly as written. Very good coffee cake! It is really moist, I love the addition of sour cream. I’ll definitely make this again!

It is a delicious recipe. I only used a thin layer of brown sugar and pecans and I baked it for 1 hour and 10 minutes. It could have used an additional 10 minutes because the center was a bit gooey. I did use picked, but frozen wild Maine blueberries. Overall, super moist and very tasty!
Delicious, easy, and always popular!
Loved it and my husband asks for it all the time. I must admit I do change the flour amount to 1 3/4 cups and haven't found a problem. Thank you so much for sharing this recipe.
I made this and everybody raved. Thought I had frozen blueberries and didn't, but rather used wild picked blackberries. Yum! This recipe is a keeper!

Here's what I did different: Used a 9"x13" baking dish instead of a Bundt cake pan. Put 2 cups of blueberries (didn't add flour to them) in the middle layer instead of mixing them into the batter. Skipped pecans because we don't like nuts in our coffee cake. This is a keeper. I will probably make another one by end of the blueberry season this year.
It is a wonderful cake! Whenever I make I get RAVE reviews! Whoever created it, you are fabulous!

It's amazing. Followed recommendations of 3/4 cup butter with 1 1/2 cups sugar and it was plenty sweet. Whip til light, and fold in sour cream by hand, then fold in dry ingredients by hand. I did a 13x9 and it was done by 30 minutes...I should've checked it a few minutes sooner, starting at 25. I also used 1.5 cups blueberries with a light coating of flour.
I used the exact recipe and it turned out moist and delicious. My husband loves it.
This recipe was Delicious. I followed the recipe as written.
Delicious !!! I added some lemon zest. A great new recipe.
Have made it several times and everyone Loves it!
I added extra cup of frozen blueberries. Great Cake, thanks for sharing the recipe!
Easy and delicious! I omitted the pecans only because I didn't have any on hand. I had extra blueberries to use up, so I added 2 cups instead of one. Very moist and tasty!

Delicious! I used all of the cinnamon mixture on the first layer. Baked beautifully! I poured a citrus (orange and lemon juice) glaze on the top while still warm. It soaked in nicely and then I dusted with icing sugar. Gorgeous, delicious and will DEFINITELY make again!
Absolutely delicious. For some reason my cake fell.
I had blueberries and pecans on hand and looked for a recipe and found this. I'm so glad I did. I followed the recipe exactly and it was amazing. I definitely will make it again.
Didn't have a bundt pan so I made a loaf instead. Also added a simple lemon icing. Turned out great!

Easy 5 stars! I screwed up the whole process and it was still delicious haha! Let me start by saying I am not an amazing baker so always follow a recipe. Chose this for my daughter who loves blueberries. After starting the instructions, I realized I don’t have a Bundt pan so tried a springform pan. Also realized I didn’t buy pecans but walnuts by mistake. AND LASTLY forgot the last step to swirl with a knife. To my surprise, still turned out SO GOOD. Will try again following the proper instructions/ bakeware! Thanks for the recipe

This is an easy, delicious recipe. The only changes I made were to make muffins instead, add crushed walnuts to the brown sugar topping, and bake them for 35 minutes. Came out like a fluffy cake with a nice toasted topping.
I just started baking Bundt cakes and this was absolutely delicious. My husband loved it and he's a picky eater. I wouldn't change a thing.
It's very delicious.
It completely fell apart when we took it out of the pan. The batter is definitely too heavy for a Bundt pan. The cake tasted pretty good though.

The cake is extremely heavy, collapsed in on itself, and is moist on the inside. We even baked it for an additional 45 minutes because it just felt so moist. Followed the recipe perfectly except for added in about half a cup of blueberries. It tastes very good though.

I followed the suggestions in other reviews; used 3/4 c butter and 1 1/2 c white sugar. Also subbed almond extract (1/2t). Coated my berries with flour, mixed in batter. Baked in 9 X 13 glass pan (well greased and floured) for 45 mins. Oh, the aroma wafting throughout my house! Am taste-testing now! I baked it for social hour at church tomorrow, but it’s going to be tough to part with it!! YUMMMMM!
Follow the directions exactly as written. Wonderful taste, and consistency. Would definitely make this again.

Sunk... Like The Titanic! 
I bake quite a bit, and was very disappointed. This was going to be a 4th of July sweet. Waste of time, ingredients, and wishful thinking.
Fabulous!

I baked this in bread pans and sliced it. To prevent the blueberries from sinking to the bottom, I didn't include them in the batter, put placed them on top of the first batter layer and pushed them down slightly, I did the same with the batter layer that went on top of the pecan/cinnamon mixture
Amazing
This didn’t turn out at all… waste of all the things

Wow, made changes, and turned out great.

Tried it with yogurt instead of sour cream to make the cake moist.

Went for strawberries instead of blueberries.

For the topping, berry jam and then lightly melted and poured cream cheese with brown sugar and cinnamon.

I used frozen blueberries tossed in a Tbsp of the flour first. I also cut the sugar to 1.5c and butter to 3/4c. it was moist and delicious and I made it a second time within days of the first being finished. The first time I made it in a 9x13 pan and the second I did 12 jumbo muffins and the rest in an 8x8 pan. On the second baking I also only put a layer of the brown sugar mix between the layers of the batter after I added the blueberries. The layer on top was just too much sweetness for us and detracted from the other flavors.
It was very moist snd sweet. I added an extra 1/2 cup blueberries and 1 tsp of cinnamon to the batter.
I made it as written but with the 2 cups of blueberries! It was fantastic! The whole family loved it.

This coffee cake was so good!!! It was moist and flavorful. My entire family enjoyed it and asked me to make it again. The only thing I would change would be to decrease the amount of sugar. 2 cups was way too much and made the cake too sweet. The next time I make it I'll use 1 1/4 cup of sugar instead.
We thought that it was really good. It even came out of my bundt pan nicely. I don't recommend putting it in the refrigerator though. It wasn't as good afterwards.
We used 1 1/2 cups sugar and 2 cups blueberries and it was fantastic! Plenty sweet
This is the best cake ever. I have made this so many time since I found the recipe. It freezes really well. We freeze it so we always have so on hand.

I agree with others that I didn’t think there was enough batter but it turned out great and I baked it in a Bundt pan. This recipe is very moist and I knew I wanted to make it because it had sour cream in it. If using a Bundt pan I would put the cinnamon/blueberry/pecan layer first in your pan so when you flip it you have that on top. Not a big deal thoough- it tastes great wherever it is! :)
really good flavor the batter alone, a bit more vanilla and sour cream added, perfect!

This was the first time that I followed the recipe exactly and didn't read any reviews beforehand. My bundt pan was 10" so it didn't raise as high, but it baked well. I let it cool completely and loosened it with a plastic knife before unmolding it (whew!). The batter is very thick , and that's probably why the (fresh) blueberries didn't sink. A nice, dense cake but I will probably use less sugar next time.
Very moist silicone pans allowed easy release.
Everyone has rant and raved over this dessert. We used 2 loaf pans for gifts. Came out fantastic!!!

Yummy! I actually made this with greek yogurt and (followed advice so) used 1/2 cup less sugar and a little more blueberries and it was great!! So moist and tasty, and I really like the tang the yogurt brings in. Overall, very yummy and was so easy to make :-)

I would just reiterate what others found useful: I decreased butter to 1 1/2 sticks and sugar to 1 1/2 cups. It really was sweet enough. I also added some more blueberries and folded them in gently. Used a 9x13 pan and it did not sink on top. Excellent taste!
Dammmm good

The cake was great, although a bit too sweet. I have made it many times and a recently I have been reducing the amount of sugar, to 1.1 cups. I often replace blueberries with other fresh fruit I have on hand. Cut up grapes and cherries work well.
Blueberry Sour Cream Coffee Cake by D Newman. Upped berries, frozen, to 1 1/2c & downed sugar to 1 1/2c. 'Partial sub w plain yogurt; all, if again. Not very cooperative with the bundt pan.

This is one of my favorites. I did not have a bundt pan so I used a 9x13. I mixed the batter and put 1/2 in the pan. Then I layered the blueberries on top of the batter followed by the topping. Repeat. Love this recipe.
Everyone requests it

Wow! Absolutely delicious, very moist and tender. No changes to the recipe; it was perfect as it was, but I can envision it being used often and perhaps using raspberries or any other berry. This recipe would be great even without the addition of fruit, similar to a coffee cake. The cinnamon, pecans and brown sugar are scrumptious in it. Kudos! A definite keeper.

I used a mix of fresh and frozen Blueberries and used 2 cups. So Because of extra moisture I added 1/4 cup flour And after reading reviews, added extra 1/4 tsp baking powder. Put most of the berries in center of batter with the strusel. Perfectly risen and did not collapse. All the rest same as recipe
Instant New Family favorite . Delicious. Moist but not dense.
Delicious
Super moist and delicious!!
Super moist and delicious!!

Delicious. After reading some of the reviews elected to reduce the sugar to 1.5 cups and it was sweet enough. Definitely a moist cake. It sank during the cool and crumbled a bit upon cutting but it was so so so good. Absolutely will make again.

I questioned the 2 cups of sugar, it was about a cup too much. It's much too sweet! There's not enough liquid, or flour the butter and sugar never became light only a heavy blob of baked sugar and butter with some blueberries!!
I made TWO of these in THREE days - yes, it was THAT GOOD! Husband loved it! Neighbors raved about it & had to have the recipe! It's really an easy, quick recipe! One I will make over & over again!
Turned out way too wet. Fell while still in the oven. I think it needs more flour and maybe some baking powder? Won't be making this again, so I don't care how to fix it
Cake is really tasty BUT I forgot to flour the pan, I greased they pan. Have never had a cake turn out this broken! Sad. Photo shows the type of bunt pan that did NOT work.
I followed the recipe exactly it came out beautifully and taste delish. I will be making this again.

I made it Gluten Free by using the Bob's Red Mill GF 1-to-1 baking flour. Because of that, I added an extra egg. Turned out perfect with great texture (which is hard to do when baking GF). Great recipe!

Looks pretty, came out of Bundt pan easily. Most importantly, tastes like it came from a bakery. I forgot to blend the streusel before mixing the cake, so I recommend doing first. Otherwise you need to stop in the middle of filling the pan. Next time I make it I will try adding more blueberries than what was in recipe.
I’m surprised I got past the batter stage of this recipe as good as it tasted. This recipe didn’t disappoint. Great’

I'very made this recipe twice, the first time it was quite doughy. 
The second time I added 1 tsp. of baking soda, baked it for 55 minutes and left it in the oven to cool. The cake was much lighter and not doughy at all.

This is fantastic. I’ve tried it and I’ve adapted it several times in different ways. I took out the blueberries and put in chocolate chips. I also followed the sprinkle the topping in the layers but then for the top added some butter to the topping to make more of a streusel. Added some all spice to the topping as well on one try. I baked it in a cheesecake pan and the crusty ness of the outside and soft cake like consistency inside is amazing!!

I have made this 2 times in one week! Absolutely delicious and easy! I used a tube pan instead of a Bundt pan. Took a little longer to cook but did just fine. I did increase the brown sugar to a cup and about 3/4 cup of pecans. Soooo delish!
I loved the recipe as is. The only thing that I did was use (2) 8” pans since I didn’t have a Bundt pan. I will definitely be making it again.
Fantastic recipe! I used fresh jumbo blueberries and it turned out great.
I followed the recipe as written. It was excellent! Even people who said they did not like blueberries loved this cake!

I made it for 6 and adjusted the recipe, great feature that it can be done through the app too. Really rich, I will use less sugar and butter last time, probably 25% less of each. I'm also a big vanilla guy so extra vanilla as well as blueberries.
it's a good recipe but it's way too much sugar, cut back maybe 1/2 cup.
It's moist and delicious. Made per recipe. Needed to bake about 15 min longer.

Oh my goodness this is so delicious!! I made everything exactly as the recipe stated except I floured the blueberries in a bag as recommended by others. Also I forgot to mix in the blueberries at the right time so I put them in the middle and on the bottom/top of the batter. It still turned out fantastic!! Thank you for this recipe! It will now be a family favorite!
Absolutely wonderful as is! Perfect for my Easter brunch. Thank you!

Difficult cake to make. A pound cake trying to be a coffee cake. Too dense, does not pour into bundt pan. You have to spoon it in. I have tried this recipe 4 times, because I want it to work. The ingredients taste great together, but it falls apart. I can't get it done in the center. Too expensive to have it fall apart. I am sad to say I won't be making this recipe again.
Outstanding, super easy to make. I live at high altitude and the batter was a bit thick, results were still perfect.
This cake is delicious! Moist and flavorful. I made no changes other than using walnuts instead of pecans because I didn’t have any. I didn’t even use a glaze. Didn’t need it. This is a keeper!

4.1.20 .."One really delicious and really unhealthy Sunday coffee cake" as the submitter states. :D I didn't add the nuts & was a bit short on sour cream so saved the day with plain yogurt. I used frozen berries so swirling cinnamon sugar was out of the question in very cold, stiff dough. 'Going to try this again with no sour cream, just plain yogurt. All the fat in the butter should be just fine. I've done that trick before. :D Oh, I upped berries to 1 1/2c & downed sugar to 1 1/2c. :o :D Very good. 'Not very cooperative with the bundt pan though.
absolutely yummy

This cake came out awesome and I wouldn’t change a thing. However, IF I were to change anything, I would add 1/2 cup of blueberries and 1/2 cup of sugar. The next time I make this, however, I will swirl the first level of nuts, cinnamon, and brown sugar into the batter the same way it is done on the top. I will be making this again. It is awesome.

Nope, terrible.
 I followed recipe as written. Heavy and dense texture, pancaked out, too sweet.
I bake a lot, so not user error.
Fresh Blueberry Cake on this site is delicious, going to stick with that one instead.
A new favorite in our house. So delicious! Thank you!!!!
Stunning! Didn’t make any changes and it was lovely
Amazing
